result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy J Otto was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.
No consumption or possession of alcohol. No entry into any bars or taverns.
Must undergo Anger Management assessment and follow throught with any recommendations.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations. Any recent assessment may be satisfacotry but leaves decision up to DOC.

supervisions.notes:
Same conditions as count 1, no additional community service hours.
Concurrent with: Count #1

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremy J Otto

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jeremy J Otto in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 3:30 PM. Voorhees states there is a resolution. State has complied with victim notification and recites the recommendation, plea G to counts 1 & 2, counts 3 & 4 - DRI. 12 mo probation, costs on each count, AODA with follow through, anger management, absolute sobriety, no possession of alcohol, no entry into bars/taverns, FT emp/schooling, 50 hours of community service. Voorhees and Otto agree. Court DRI counts 3 & 4. Otto pleads G to counts 1 & 2 as alleged. Court is handed PLQ, court goes over form with Otto. Court finds defendant is freely, voluntarily and intelligently entering his plea, waiving his constitutional rights, court finds factual basis and adjudges guilty in both counts 1 & 2. State makes final statement. Voorehees makes final statement. Defendant with holds comment. Victim is in court room and makes statement. Court accepts joint recommendation and sentences the defendant to the following: with hold sentence on counts 1 & 2 - place on probation for 1 year with conditions of: AODA and follow through with any recommendations and any recent assessment may be satisfactory but leaves up to DOC agent, anger management and follow through with any recommendations, no consumpion or possession of alcohol, no entry into any bars or taverns, FT employment/schooling, costs on each count along with domestic abuse surcharge, 50 hours of community service (one count only), DNA sample with costs (expungement given), appeal rights given. Voorhees questions costs through probation. Court orders costs to now be paid to Clerk of Court, 60 DTP/CO, Voorhees asks for payment plan. Court imposes payment of $100/month commencing November 15th.
Final pre-trial on October 10, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Jeremy J Otto in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:19 AM. State - defendant represented to him that he does have SPD but not sure who. Otto does have complaint. Court reads charges and penalties. Otto understands charges and penalties, does qualify for SPD. Recess until SPD is available today, continues bond. Recalled at 10:27 AM, Attorney Voorhees appears via telephone. Recess again at 10:27 as Voorhees is almost here. Recalled at 10:46 and now all parties are here in person. Voorhees has seen the complaint, waives further reading, enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts pleas, continues bond and sets for FPT.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 10, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
No consumption of alcohol. No contact with victim (PR)
